snippet.title: Toshiba Excite Write
snippet.description: Though it doesn't have any glaring problems, $600 is way too much for a tablet that fails to stand out in any significant way.

snippet.title: Huawei Honor 3X review
snippet.description: The Honor 3X offers great performance and specs for its low price. However, unless you're getting a local version with Google Mobile Services pre-installed, you will not be getting the full flavor of Android without some effort.

snippet.title: Vizio M601d-A3R review
snippet.description: The 60-inch Vizio M1d-A3R doesn't quite offer the very best value for money in the company's range, but nevertheless features fine picture quality in a large size.

snippet.title: Samsung UNF6300 series review
snippet.description: Although its picture quality falls short of the competition, the Samsung UNF6300's high-end features and design for a midrange price will win plenty of converts.

snippet.title: Dyson DC40 Origin Review
snippet.description: You could do a lot worse than the DC40; however, you could also do better and spend less.

snippet.title: Write: Tablet Notepad/Journal
snippet.description: If you're looking for power features, Write doesn't have them. Otherwise, it's a perfect app for tablet owners who want to get focused on their writing.

snippet.title: KitchenAid 5-Speed Diamond Blender Review
snippet.description: If you're looking for a blender that can multitask and do more than just make smoothies, but don't want to shell out a lot of money, the KitchenAid 5-Speed Diamond Blender is a great option.

snippet.title: G-Technology G-Drive Slim review
snippet.description: Those with a notebook computer, especially a MacBook Air, will find the G-Drive Slim a very good companion.

snippet.title: Insteon LED Bulb
snippet.description: At just $29.99 per bulb, this automatable light source will fit nicely into existing home automation networks, serving as an appealing alternative to more expensive dimmer modules and smart switches.
